item.title: Viewability Tags
item.description: Using third-party analytics, you can track your Taboola Ad impressions and see how well they meet desired brand safety and viewability outcomes. See: Viewability Tags.

item.title: Auto-Publisher Targeting
item.description: Occasionally, SmartBid (aka the AutoBlocker) automatically blocks a publisher that performs poorly, so that it does not impact campaign performance. You can view this list of suppressed publishers via the readonly auto_publisher_targeting field.

item.title: Item Image Management
item.description: The API now provides utility methods for uploading and managing campaign item images.

item.title: Campaign Summary Report - Region and DMA Dimensions
item.description: The Campaign Summary Report now supports Region and DMA dimensions.

item.title: Separate Fields for Region and DMA Targeting
item.description: You can now apply Region and DMA Targeting via new, 'specific' Campaign properties: region_country_targeting and dma_country_targeting.

item.title: External Brand Safety
item.description: To ensure that your creatives appear alongside content that is right for your brand, you can apply external brand safety to your campaign. See External Brand Safety.

item.title: Block Publishers At The Account Level
item.description: You can now suppress specific publishers at the account level (i.e. for all campaigns). See: Account Level Blocking.

item.title: Create a Batch of Campaign Items
item.description: The mass endpoint allows you to create a batch of campaign items - each item with a url, title and thumbnail that you provide.

item.title: Custom Audience Targeting - Exclude by default
item.description: When creating a new custom audience, you can use the exclude_from_campaigns field to exclude that audience by default from all campaigns.

item.title: Reject Reason (Campaigns and Items)
item.description: The API now provides a reject_reason field for Campaigns and Items. If the Campaign or Item were rejected, the reject_reason field provides the reason. See: Campaign Fields > policy_reviewItem Fields > policy_review

item.title: Network Level Custom Audiences
item.description: Network-level Custom Audiences can now be targeted (Bug Fix).

item.title: Lookalike Audiences
item.description: It is now possible to target Lookalike Audiences through the API. See: Get Lookalike Audience Targeting Update Lookalike Audience Targeting

item.title: Custom Audience Rules
item.description: It is now possible to create/update a Custom Audience Rule through the API. The API also allows you to configure default suppression settings for the custom audience. See: Custom Audience Quick ReferenceCreate a Custom Audience Rule

item.title: Audience Size
item.description: The API now provides an audience_size field for Custom Audiences (as well as Marketplace Audiences). See: Custom Audience Rules > audience_sizeGet Marketplace Audiences
